document_data.name: Amnurflow
document_data.mainbody: The '''Amnurflow''' was a river in [[Amn]] that flowed into [[Lake Weng]].
document_data.Geography: The river was the northernmost of the tributaries of Lake Weng. It began in the [[Cloud Peaks]] west of [[Citadel Amnur]]. Midway to Lake Weng, it was joined by the [[Rashturiver]] from the east. [[Comassur Creek]] merged with the Amnurflow five miles northeast of the lake.
document_data.History: This river was named after General [[Amnur]], a legendary military man who was the younger brother of the second king of Amn.
